text: Talib Jauhari (27 August 1929 – 22 June 2020) () was a Pakistani Islamic scholar, poet, historian and philosopher. His works focused on the Shia Sect of Islam. Jauhari was born in Patna, Bihar. Jauhari was known for his interpretations of the Quran His best known book was Hadees e Karabala. Jauhari died on 22 June 2020 at a hospital in Karachi, Pakistan from heart disease-related problems and COVID-19, aged 91.Allama Talib Jauhari, Pakistan’s renowned Shia scholar, passes away ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Karachi Category:Deaths from heart disease Category:Pakistani writers Category:Pakistani educators Category:Pakistani philosophers Category:Pakistani historians
title: Talib Jauhari
